data.title: Ron Sexton death updates — Comedian behind Donnie Baker on The Bob & Tom Show dies, 52, as wife says cause still unknown
data.meta_description: COMEDIAN Ron Sexton who voiced Donnie Baker on The Bob and Tom Show has died suddenly at the age of 52.His family confirmed the news on his official F
data.text:
Live Blog

STAR GONE

Ron Sexton death updates — Comedian behind Donnie Baker on The Bob & Tom Show dies, 52, as wife says cause still unknown

COMEDIAN Ron Sexton who voiced Donnie Baker on The Bob and Tom Show has died suddenly at the age of 52.

His family confirmed the news on his official Facebook page.

"He was Donnie Baker to most of you, but Ron and Dad to us," Ron's family wrote in the post.

"Please respect our privacy at this time and pray for our family."

The comedian's wife, Tracey confirmed that his cause of death remains unknown.

Read our Ron Sexton blog below for the latest updates...

'He was a different breed'

Kristen Tuff Scott continued in her tribute:

"A friend like him doesn’t come around a lot."

"That’s one of the many things that made him special. He cared about ya, and not in a “how can I make money?” kind of way… He was a different breed."

"Ima miss you Ron!"

Kristen Tuff Scott grieves Ron Sexton

Along with two photos of the stars posing together, singer Kristen Tuff Scott posted a tribute on Facebook.

"My mind still hasn’t processed this all the way! I’m kinda just numb dude," she wrote.

"Donnie Baker was amazing…he always called or text to check in, or just bs."

Comedian Chelcie Lynn mourns

Chelcie Lynn, who performs under the name Trailer Trash Tammy, is mourning the loss of her friend.

“I’m not even sure what to say..Ron was a good friend man. Such a cool dude. This sucks,” she wrote on Facebook.

“RIP Donnie Baker.”

Ron Sexton’s best friend reflects on his legacy

The comedian’s drummer and best friend, Dusty Privette, wrote: "In reflecting on Ronnie’s life and the legacy he leaves behind, I can't help but marvel at the profound impact he made.

"Ron Sexton, as Donnie Baker, brought joy, laughter, and an authentic connection to countless lives. His ability to make people feel like they were part of something special was a testament to his remarkable character.

"As we mourn the loss of a dear friend and extraordinary entertainer, let us remember Ron Sexton, not only for his comedic brilliance but also for the immense love he had for his fans.

He concluded: "May his memory continue to bring laughter and happiness to all who were touched by his genuine spirit. I was extremely lucky to be in his shadow."

Ron Sexton's best friend says fans 'motivated' him

The comedian's drummer and best friend, Dusty Privette, shared a statement with the Bob & Tom Show, writing: "The incredible support and unwavering loyalty of his fans fueled Ronnie’s passion for comedy.

"It was their laughter that motivated him to push the boundaries of his creativity and deliver unforgettable performances.

"He often spoke about how blessed he was to have such a devoted fan base, and he never took their support for granted."

Ron Sexton's massive following

Ron Sexton gained a huge following through his comedic work and his time on The Bob and Tom Show.

His Twitter account for his character Donnie Baker has garnered more than 87,000 followers.

The comedian's Instagram has over 100,000 followers.

The Bob & Tom Show pays tribute, continued

The tribute continued: “Ron was a much-loved colleague and friend, and we will miss him greatly.”

“We send our sincerest condolences to his family and friends. He made many, many people happy during his more than 20 years with ‘The Bob & Tom Show,’ and we will remember him with love and gratitude.”

The Bob & Tom Show pays tribute

Tom Griswold, Ron’s comedic partner on The Bob & Tom Show paid tribute to him on Twitter.

The post read: “We are sad to confirm that Ron Sexton, longtime member of the ensemble cast of ‘The Bob & Tom Show’, died Friday in Ohio while on tour with his stand-up comedy show.

“Ron was known by millions of listeners of ‘The Bob & Tom Show’ for the indelible comedic characters he played on-air – including Donnie Baker, Kenny Tarmac, and Floyd the Trucker, as well as his spot-on celebrity impersonations.”

Ron Sexton's impressions of well-known celebs

Ron Sexton made several recurring celebrity impressions on The Bob & Tom Show. They include:

Sir Charles

Morgan Freeman

James Gandolfini

Jerry Jones

Dr. Phil

Steven Seagal

Babe Ruth

The Bob & Tom Show former members

A handful of stars are no longer members of the show:

Bob Kevoian - co-host and engineer

Scott Potasnik – comedian

Pat Carlini – news

Dave Gunn – sports

Ron Sexton - comedian

The Bob & Tom Show members

The Bob & Tom Show features co-hosts, comedians, an engineer, and a musician.

Tom Griswold - co-host

Chick McGee - co-host

Kristi Lee - co-host

Josh Arnold - comedian

Willie Griswold - comedian

Ace Cosby - engineer

Pat Godwin - musician

Characters Ron Sexton played

Ron Sexton played several characters on The Bob & Tom show, including:

Floyd the Truck Driver

Rick

Donnie Baker

Coach Ralph Fontaine

Kenny Tarmac

Ron’s best friend pays heartbreaking tribute, part three

Dusty Privette went on to talk about the comedian's interactions with fans, saying: "His interactions with fans were nothing short of incredible. Ron had an uncanny ability to make people feel seen, heard, and valued.

"Whether it was sharing a heartfelt conversation, signing autographs, or posing for countless selfies, he made each fan feel like they were the most important person in the world.

"Ron's infectious laughter and genuine interest in their lives created lasting memories for all who had the pleasure of meeting him."

Dusty went on to say that Ron interacted with fans on social media, adding: "Ron understood the power of connection and the impact he could have on someone's day with just a few kind words."

Ron’s best friend pays heartbreaking tribute, continued

The tribute continues: “It was a sight to behold when Ron stepped on stage, transforming into Donnie Baker, the lovable character that captured the hearts of audiences everywhere.

“But it was behind the scenes where Ron’s true nature shone brightly. He would spend endless hours after each show, making sure he met every fan who wanted to connect with him.

“It didn’t matter if it took all night; Ron was determined to show his gratitude and reciprocate the love he received.”

Ron’s best friend pays heartbreaking tribute

Drummer Dusty Privette has shared a heartbreaking statement to the Bob & Tom Show following the death of one his best friends, Ron Sexton.

“I wanted to take a moment to share with you the profound admiration I have for Ron Sexton aka Donnie Baker,” the show shared his tribute on Twitter.

“As his closest friend, I had the privilege of 17 years of shows and a million miles across America. I witnessed firsthand the incredible bond he forged with those who supported his craft.

The statement continued: “Ron’s dedication to his fans was unparalleled, and his genuine appreciation for their unwavering support knew no bounds.”

Funeral services will be private

Ron’s wife and mother of his four children, Eric, Abigail, Alex, and Aliah, added that despite his popularity, the comedian “didn’t like attention.”

As such, the family will not be holding public funeral services, with his wife adding that social media tributes will act as his viewing.

Tracey also confirmed that the cause of Ron’s sudden passing is still unknown.

His grieving wife also took a moment to thank all of her husband’s fans, as she concluded: “I appreciate all of you who are taking the time to honor him. He was one of a kind.”

Ron Sexton's attack months before death, part two

Ron Sexton's rental Buick was struck at least nine times, with the rear window shot out, according to a police report.

The Bob and Tom Show comedian suffered injuries to his ear and cheek consistent with shattered glass being blown on his face, records show.

In October 2021, Sexton filed a police report against Paul after he attacked him and threatened him and his family, according to NBC affiliate WTHR.

Mrs. Berkemeier corroborated Sexton's story, telling police her husband became angry when he found out she left their home near Shelbyville to meet up with Sexton, court docs showed.

Paul was arrested and charged with attempted murder and unlawful firearm carrying due to a 2017 felony conviction for theft.

Ron Sexton was attacked months before death

Ron Sexton was the victim of a shooting by the husband of the woman he was having an affair with, according to court documents.

The comedian told police that on December 11, 2022, after his performance in Portland, Indiana, he contacted the woman, identified only as Mrs. Berkemeier, and asked to meet her at a local bar in Indianapolis.

Sexton, who was staying at a nearby hotel and was in town for the show, told police that when he drove to the parking garage, he noticed a sedan traveling closely behind him.

Sexton told police that he recognized the driver as Mrs. Berkemeier’s husband, Paul, whom he had seen on several occasions before.

Ron Sexton died at age 52

Comedian Ron Sexton has died at the age of 52.

His cause of death has not yet been revealed.

Love to Abbie Sexton

Many are sending love to Abbie Sexton on her recent Facebook post after news broke that her father had died.

One comment read: “I’m so very sorry! Sending prayers for all of you.”

“Abbie there are no words…. Please know you and your family are in my prayers. I hope you can feel the love, prayers and support all around you and it helps to carry you through this extremely difficult time,” another wrote.

“So very sorry, Abbie. Your family is in my prayers,” added a third.

Ron Sexton’s massive social media following

Ron Sexton’s character Donnie Baker was beloved in the comedy community.

He had over 371,000 followers on TikTok and amassed over 1.5million likes on his videos.

His Instagram account had over 124,000 followers and his YouTube had over 255,000 subscribers.

Donnie Baker’s Facebook account had over 1million followers.

Ron Sexton’s wife pays tribute

Ron Sexton’s wife, Tracey said in a statement to The U.S Sun: “Though his talent was unparalleled, Ron was so much more than Donnie Baker. He was a loving husband, father, son, friend, and coach,”

“We know he’s at peace and are proud to know he will continue to make people around the world laugh forever.

“We appreciate all of the love and support.”

The cause of death has still not been determined.

One friend says Sexton ‘chased his dreams’

Ron Sexton’s friend Rich Nye, a local journalist, recalled growing up with the comedian.

He wrote on Twitter: “Ron Sexton was one of my best friends & neighbor growing up. We chased our dreams of becoming sportscasters together from Franklin Central to Butler.

“I am deeply saddened & regret that I didn’t try harder to reconnect in recent years. My prayers are with his family.”

Ron Sexton was a strong presence in his community

Ron Sexton was a strong presence in his community, appearing frequently on the radio and coaching the high school baseball team.

The Dunedin High School Baseball team posted a photo of Sexton with the players and wrote: “The Dunedin Falcon baseball community mourns the passing of former head coach Ron Sexton, who passed away yesterday.

“We send our most heart felt condolences to his friends and family.”
